channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
I wonder why I’m just hearing about this now. https://t.co/YZIoJ0nujW
Twitter has a great api, I’ve been doing apps with it since 2007. Here’s a simple easy app every twitter writer should know about imho.
https://t.co/KAVhNd06pG
Family beat man because they ‘made’ son gay, victim told cops. https://t.co/Sjmif6Xd3r
@rtanglao @revolver_coffee I'll be right there. ;-)
Have you had Covid?
Naturism vs. Nudism: It's a cultural thing. https://t.co/cVBOv7BSLD
@jeffjarvis No marketing.

When trying to figure out "web3" -- remember that the tech industry often is infatuated with tech whose value seems elusive, and in the end turns out not to have been there. Even if they don't intend them to be a Ponzi schemes, in practice that's what they are.
An engineer at one of the famous hype balloon companies told a reporter their CEO was a snake oil salesman. He said the quiet part out loud. ;-)
But sometimes the in tech turns out to be as big as the hype or bigger. The web was one of those things. Before it, laser printers and LANs. And personal computers.
But for every one of those there are five that amount to nothing.

@ElieNYC @joanwalsh we're wasting your talent and expertise on stuff like this. you should be on the road teaching everyone how broken the constitution is, and explaining how the repubs are breaking it even more. as you point out there's nothing new or interesting about mcconnell's depravity.

I like applying the "truth sandwich" approach on Twitter. First put the truth as a reply to the post in question. Then "Quote retweet" it with another quick bit of snark that replays the point made in the reply.

But seriously folks, the president's approval rating is just how the news, as it's reported, bounces off the minds of the people the pollsters talk to. You could model it like they model weather reports, and tune up the news coverage to create any approval rating you want. https://t.co/LwPdZEvPaE
@politicalwire We should just discount it down to zero and then view 39% as a historic high.
St. Augustine Beach renourishment: Army Corps will spend up to $62M. https://t.co/MXkXwTJD66
I watched a tiny bit of the French presidential debate yesterday and what struck me is how civil they were with each other. That is compared to US politics.

It could be that the solution to the climate crisis will come from someone who @mattyglesias and his ilk consider unworthy. As long as they control which ideas are heard, we are lost. https://t.co/Y4JXmhTrLa
I've noticed that the "in" people listen to me a little when I have "Harvard" in my Twitter bio.
My ideas are the same whether or not you see that badge.
And even when I was working at Harvard I couldn't get the people at WBUR to listen to the project I was working on, getting podcasting off the ground.
People. Just. Don't. Listen.
The big problem isn't climate change, it's getting people to work together instead of just working for themselves. And to start working together we have to learn how to listen. It's hard, when we're raised to not listen.
It'll be interesting to see if any fans show up in Brooklyn to support the Nets.
@jeffjarvis The Sims was fun, but it was third person, not first like second life, and the human player in the sims is god. I spent years immersed in it. Also SimCity.
@jeffjarvis The people who think we’re unworthy never listen, I’ve noticed. 😀
Robert Morse Dead: ‘Mad Men’ Star and Two-Time Tony Winner Was 90. https://t.co/EH6FW1YtUi

@AdamKinzinger If you’re uncomfortable in line at the store you can leave. That’s a pretty big difference. Also, I doubt the air in the tube is as clean as you think. In the old days when you could smoke the whole plane reeked of cigarette smoke.
@jeffjarvis That's kind of what I thought. ;-)
New Jersey, New York preparing for recreational marijuana sales. https://t.co/fydBuefuaW
After reading this Wikipedia article I still don’t understand what “full stop” means. Instead of saying “full stop” couldn’t you just stop? https://t.co/DjND9c73bn
I’m a lifetime Knicks fan, rooting for the Celtics proving life is weird.
